1.title: Hot in Cleveland ... One More Time
1.plot: In the series premiere, Valerie prepares a lunch for her Hot in Cleveland (2010) co-stars, Jane Leeves, Wendie Malick and Betty White. On the menu: Quiche Valerie; Italian tuna salad; grilled romaine with balsamic dressing; panna cotta.

2.title: Dinner for My Best Friend!
2.plot: Valerie cooks an Italian meal for her husband, Tom Vitale, who helps out by making a special cocktail for the occasion. On the menu is bruschetta, herb-roasted baby beets, chicken cutlets with arugula and lemon dressing, and a chocolate-mint sundae.

3.title: Pizza Party! Everyone's Tossing
3.plot: Valerie invites her family over for do-it-yourself personal pizzas with pesto sauce, kale chips as an appetizer, sneaky salad, lemon-blueberry-cheesecake parfaits, and kid-friendly watermelon spritzes.

4.title: Bootcamp Brunch
4.plot: A post-workout brunch is made. On the menu: a kale-and-quinoa salad; cherry-coconut scuffins; leftover veggie frittata; open-faced avocado toast; and blueberry smoothies.

5.title: Grillin' and Chillin' with the Family
5.plot: Casual California cuisine is on the menu, when Valerie hosts a backyard barbecue, inspired by a trip to the farmers' market. Dishes include salsa and guacamole; roasted corn and bean salad; chicken kabobs with tequila-lime cilantro; margarita with jalapeño and ginger; and brownie bites.

6.title: Best Girls' Night In
6.plot: Valerie hosts a book club meeting for her girlfriends. On the menu: cream cheese crab spread with homemade crostini; butter lettuce salad with hazelnuts and bacon bits; spicy arrabiata penne; and black pepper walnut biscotti and affogato.

7.title: Last-Minute Dinner Guests
7.plot: Recipes for last-minute dinner guests. Included: crazy-easy quickbread; sliced cauliflower steaks with raisins and pine nuts; baked salmon with honey-mustard sauce; the summer Manhattan; and berries with limoncello and basil.

8.title: Valerie Gives Back
8.plot: Valerie throws a cocktail party for fellow volunteers, who spent their morning helping out at an adoption event for homeless animals. On the menu: pureed artichoke crostini with lime salt; mini-cucumber soup; Italian finger sandwiches; deviled eggs.

9.title: Football Fun and Food
9.plot: Valerie prepares a Cajun-style spread, when she invites her family over for some football, fun and food. On the menu: a quick gumbo; fresh spring salad; red-pepper hummus; and a Sicilian loaf cake, in honor of her father-in-law.

1.title: Poker Night
1.plot: Valerie hosts a poker night. On the menu: Southwestern egg rolls with salsa; teriyaki rumaki; a salad made with orzo, grape tomatoes and radishes; and sliders topped with apple, ham and cheddar.

2.title: Thanksgiving: The Perfect Bite!
2.plot: Valerie makes a Thanksgiving feast for her gal pals. On the menu: sweet and salty pepitas; acorn squash with baby bitter greens dressed with sherry-shallot vinaigrette; deep-fried turkey topped with gravy; pumpkin pie with cinnamon buttermilk whipped cream.

3.title: Fab Dinner for My Fab Friends!
3.plot: Valerie makes a home-cooked meal for her friends. On the menu: mixed baby greens with crispy polenta croûtons; peppered beef tenderloin with horseradish panna cotta; and blueberry tart. Also: a recipe for honey-and-hazelnut granola.

4.title: Ho! Ho! Ho! Company's Coming
4.plot: A holiday buffet is prepared by Valerie, who serves traditional recipes with a twist. Included: Neapolitan holiday cookies; lasagna alla Besciamella; cheesy sausage snacks; a festive salad with tomatoes, mozzarella and basil in creamy vinaigrette; and sparkling berry Kir Royales.

5.title: Italian Dinner for a French Chef
5.plot: Valerie cooks an Italian dinner for French chef Ludo Lefebvre and his wife, Krissy Lefebvre. The menu includes panzanella; corn and cauliflower with bourbon-infused butter; branzino baked with a gremolata; and Manhattans.

6.title: After the Ball Is Over
6.plot: Foods, that are filling but not fattening, are on the menu after a hike with her One Day at a Time (1975) co-star Mackenzie Phillips. Recipes include a vegetable-and-egg-white breakfast fajitas; grilled chicken salad with apples and grapes in lettuce cups for lunch; for dinner, grilled chicken veggie soup and mini-pear compote crumble with maple yogurt.

7.title: It's a Honey-Do Day
7.plot: Valerie rewards her husband, Tom Vitale, for completing a long list of chores, with some of his favorite dishes. Included: eggs Benedict; prosciutto brushetta; spicy coconut shrimp; and a unique butterscotch version of an Italian love cake.

8.title: Lazy Sunday Dinner
8.plot: Valerie and her husband create a Sunday meal that allows them to use up food in their pantry.

9.title: Chick Flick TV Marathon
9.plot: Valerie prepares a couch-friendly menu for a night of TV-watching with Faith Ford. Recipes include marinated cucumber salad; slow-cooked red beans and rice; homemade rosemary-pepper crackers; and frosted brownies.

10.title: Big Game, Big Flavors!
10.plot: Valerie invites her family and friends over to watch the game, so she's making Italian Beef Sandwiches with a Giardiniera Aioli and an Italian-style fennel Cole Slaw. For dessert, she makes Salted Caramel Chocolate Chip Cookies.

11.title: Wolfie's Home!
11.plot: Valerie's musician son, Wolfgang Van Halen, returns home, after months of touring. To celebrate, his favorite foods are made. Included: pasta e fagioli; turkey meatloaf; roasted broccoli rabe; and pumpkin pudding, Wolfie's favorite dessert.

12.title: A Very Valerie Valentine's Day
12.plot: Valentine's Day is celebrated. Recipes include chocolate-walnut scuffins; fennel salad with goat cheese and pine nuts; spaghetti with onion, bacon and tomato; pizzelle cones filled with chocolate-ginger mousse.

13.title: My Favorite Indulgences
13.plot: An avocado face mask and comfort foods are part of a day of indulgences for Valerie. Recipes include: a martini served with blue cheese-stuffed olives; pasta alla vongole with roasted asparagus; mushrooms with spicy chili salt. Also: limoncello challah bread pudding.

14.title: Mighty Neighborly of You
14.plot: Valerie wants to thank her neighbors for taking care of her dog, picking up her mail and bringing in packages. She whips up Lamb Shepherd's Pie, Arugula Salad with Champagne Vinaigrette, Hazelnut Toffee and Rosemary Gin Fizzes.

1.title: Perfect Bites Before
1.plot: Valerie invites her Hot in Cleveland (2010) co-stars, Jane Leeves, Wendie Malick and Betty White, over for lunch. On the menu: glazed short rib crostini; chicken salay and steamed veggies with peanut sauce; mini roasted potatoes with eggplant caviar and crème fraiche; vodka cucumber spritz.

2.title: Just Me and My Boys
2.plot: Valerie starts a new family tradition to honor some of the special men in her life. On the menu: chipotle cheeseburgers with homemade barbecue sauce; spinach and strawberry salad topped with a warm bacon vinaigrette; onion rings served with a refreshing ginger beer lime Rickey.

3.title: Too Hot to Cook
3.plot: Recipes, for when it's too hot to cook, are tested by Valerie and her friend, Faith Ford. The menu includes lobster club sandwiches; savory pickle spears; a classic Greek salad; honey citrus Southern iced tea; microwave potato chips; and lemon icebox cake.

4.title: Stress-Free Summer Fiesta!
4.plot: Valerie hosts an all-girls meet and greet. She invites Krissy Lefebvre, Michelle Branch, Kelly Oxford and Melissa Peterman. On the summer-theme menu: queso fundido; a fix-it-yourself catfish taco bar; jalapeno ranch slaw; and a watermelon cocktail.

5.title: Home Alone... And I Like It
5.plot: Valerie researches family recipes for her next cookbook; and makes a dinner using some favorite pantry staples. On the menu: smoky cheddar crackers; pasta al tonno; roasted artichoke hearts Provencal; and blueberry cheesecake filo cups.

6.title: Everything Retro Is New Again
6.plot: Old favorites are given a new twist. Included: chopped iceberg salad with Roquefort dressing; tuna noodle casserole; cherry cheesecake pie.

7.title: Bang for Your Buck Barbecue
7.plot: A casual backyard barbecue has grilled chicken; baked beans with brown sugar and bacon; grilled vegetable kabobs and a refreshing lemon basil granita on the menu.

8.title: Bacon, Bacon, Bacon: Bacon Makes Everything Better
8.plot: An all-bacon menu includes: bacon-wrapped jalapeno shrimp with cherry cola barbecue sauce; tomato salad with a balsamic dressing topped with crumbled pancetta; and bacon-caramel scuffins topped with caramel clotted cream. Food blogger Jo Oyakawa Stougaard stops by for a visit.

9.title: Only the Best for My Wolfie!
9.plot: Valerie celebrates her son's, Wolfgang Van Halen, birthday by making his favorites, which include spatchcock roasted chicken with salsa verde; garlicky broccoli fusilli; oven-roasted spicy sweet potato fries with homemade ranch dip; and vanilla cake with vanilla cream cheese frosting.

10.title: Little Italy in My Kitchen
10.plot: Valerie cooks some classic Italian dishes for her friend, Alex Guarnaschelli. On the menu: sausage and pepper sliders; spaghetti and meatballs; Proscecco with limoncello and candied lemon slices; and fresh homemade cannolis.

11.title: Kids Baking Championship Reunion
11.plot: Valerie hosts lunch for two kid chefs. On the menu: grilled Italian paninis with Provolone, Genoa salami, Black Forest ham and roast turkey; salt and vinegar zucchini chips; soft pretzels with chocolate hazelnut dip; and decorate your own chocolate cupcakes with Neapolitan frosting and treats sent by Duff Goldman.

12.title: Cheat Day
12.plot: Guilty pleasures dishes are on the menu. Included: chicken with prunes and olives; Italian wedge salad with Gorgonzola topped with crispy pancetta; vegetable pot stickers; mini zeppoles with a caramel marsala dipping sauce.

13.title: Summer Grilling Send-Off
13.plot: An end-of-summer barbecue includes salmon burgers; avocado and grilled corn salad with goddess dressing; sweet potato wedges; and pound cake with peaches drizzled with cinnamon simple syrup.

1.title: Quick and Easy Movie Night
1.plot: Friends are invited over for a movie night under the stars. On the menu are quick and easy recipes for crab boil sliders; s'mores popcorn; lemon Dijon potato salad; and a homemade limeade and mint soda.

2.title: Valerie to the Rescue
2.plot: A friend, who injured himself falling off a ladder, receives a home-cooked meal from Valerie. On the menu: citrus-marinated olives; manicotti stuffed with ricotta and Italian sausage; Tuscan kale salad with anchovy dressing; and strawberry love cake.

3.title: I Could Do That Blindfolded
3.plot: Valerie plans an effortless meal to serve while playing a favorite card game with friends who are visiting from Ohio. The menu includes: Everything Snack Mix; three-bean turkey chili; broccoli-carrot salad; sweet and savory cornbread cookies; and a LOL martini.

4.title: 4th Down and Yum
4.plot: Valerie Bertinelli teams up with Eddie Jackson to host a football-theme party. On the menu: slow-cooked sloppy joe sliders; homemade potato chips topped with chicken salt; roasted carrot hummus; peanut butter brownies topped with salted pretzels; and a sweet tea and lemonade lager.

5.title: Brother vs. Brother
5.plot: A homebrew rivalry between siblings inspires Valerie to make a beer-centric meal. On the menu: slow-cooker pulled pork with fresh shallots and chiles; potato skins stuffed with beer cheese, scallions and bacon; pan-roasted tomatoes with quick balsamic jam; and a stout caramel milkshake for dessert.

6.title: I'm Outta Here
6.plot: Valerie Bertinelli prepares make-ahead meals for her husband to enjoy, while she's in Arizona. On the menu: a salad made with farro, roasted beets, and goat cheese; beef bourguigon; a French beef sandwich; and blueberry cake with lemon macaroon cream.

7.title: Pumpkins, Sweets and Treats
7.plot: Valerie Bertinelli celebrates the season with her sister-in-law and nephew, with an autumn-themed menu: butternut squash and arugula pizza on homemade pizza dough; mini caramel apples; baked pumpkin doughnuts; spiced pumpkin mochas.

8.title: Oh, the Weather Outside Is Frightful
8.plot: Valerie Bertinelli and her husband, Tom Vitale, prepare comfort food, like shrimp scampi with herb breadcrumbs; pull-apart garlic bread with asiago; Helen's orange and fennel salad; crispy chocolate mint cookies; and hot chai with spiced rum.

9.title: Thankful for Family
9.plot: Valerie and her husband, Tom, host both of their families for a Thanksgiving feast to remember; the holiday spread includes fennel and citrus roasted turkey with gravy, cinnamon raisin bread stuffing with sausage, and Mom's Waldorf salad.

10.title: The Days Grow Shorter and the Nights Longer
10.plot: Valerie Bertinelli and her husband, Tom, entertain two of their good pals, on one of the shortest days of the year; Valerie makes her slow-cooker mulled wine, fried chickpeas with sage and Parmesan, and turkey sausage with fennel sauerkraut.

11.title: Blended Holidaze
11.plot: The Bertinelli and Vitale clans celebrate the holidays; crown roast of lamb with mint and green onion pesto; almond-cranberry rice pilaf; roasted winter vegetables; Christmas morning cinnamon rolls; holiday cranberry-orange punch.

12.title: Jet Lag Dinner
12.plot: Valerie Bertinelli prepares a sweet and savory breakfast-for-dinner for her husband, Tom Vitale; everything savory potato waffles with smoked salmon; watercress and citrus salad; a Dutch baby pancake with raspberry-orange coulis; grapefruitini.

13.title: Clean Eats
13.plot: Valerie Bertinelli presents tasty guilt-free recipes; slow-cooker steel-cut oats; grilled chopped vegetable salad; kale and artichoke chicken casserole; healthy banana-cherry custard.

1.title: Comfort Food, Cuban-Style
1.plot: Memories of a weekend in Florida inspire Valerie Bertinelli to make Cuban food at home; Cubano salad; Cuban sandwiches with slow cooker pulled pork; spicy black bean soup; a tropical sundae; grapefruit mojitos.

2.title: Wine Club Party
2.plot: Valerie Bertinelli cooks for her friends' semi-annual wine club party.

3.title: My Kind of Town: Chicago
3.plot: Valerie Bertinelli invites her friend and another Chicago transplant over for a taste of their hometown; deep dish sausage pizza; cheese and caramel popcorn; Italian pizzeria salad; chocolate hazelnut pull-apart bread.

4.title: Homemade Happy Hour
4.plot: Valerie Bertinelli invites her glam squad for happy hour; turkey cranberry sliders; roasted cauliflower popcorn with chili lime seasoning; jalapeno fries with roasted garlic ranch dipping sauce; key lime pie martini.

5.title: Valerie Cooks So-Cal Style
5.plot: Valerie Bertinelli and her longtime babysitter and friend, Elia, cooks So-Cal style Mexican recipes; chicken enchiladas with classic sauce; casa vega style tostada salad; roasted salsa; refried beans; smoky margarita with mescal.

6.title: Kitchen Cousins
6.plot: Valerie Bertinelli makes healthier versions of her husband's cousins' favorite Italian recipes; classic salami pie; Italian veg pie; crunchy romaine salad with a sweet sesame vinaigrette; pepperoni rolls with homemade marinara; spumoni.

7.title: When Life Gives You Lemons... Rejoice!
7.plot: Valerie Bertinelli learns about lemons and invites actress Melissa Peterman over. On the menu: Greek lemon soup with chicken; crispy pancetta crostini with arugula lemon pesto; lemon love cake; lemonade Moscow Mules.

8.title: Recipe Renovation
8.plot: Valerie Bertinelli shows off her new and organized closet; crunchy mustard chicken bake; snap pea and radish salad with mint and tarragon; aperol spritzers; red and green grape galette with a fennel crust and red wine syrup for dessert.

9.title: Let's Get Social
9.plot: Valerie Bertinelli and her pal, food blogger Jo Oyakawa Stougaard, expands her social media reach; roasted vegetable soup; Tuscan pesto pizza with shrimp scampi; shortbread and lemon cheesecake; spiked strawberry lemonades.

10.title: Happy Birthday Spicy Mud
10.plot: Valerie Bertinelli celebrates her little brother's birthday with a spicy feast; chili rubbed beef with garlic herb oil; jalapeno mac and cheese; sweet and spicy popcorn; blistered green beans with spicy chile sauce; Mexican chocolate cake.

11.title: Old World Meets New World
11.plot: Valerie Bertinelli's old friends and the other four Fab Five birthday celebrants enjoy a favorite old world recipe: her gnocchi with marinara sauce; Valerie adds some modern recipes; prime rib, Brussel sprouts with pancetta, and a mixed berry tart.

12.title: Dinner Fit for a Queen
12.plot: Valerie Bertinelli cooks a springtime feast for her family; Valerie video chats with her mom; her menu includes honey mustard glazed ham, pea and mint risotto, strawberry shortcake truffles, and cinnamon sugared walnuts.

13.title: All Day Grilling
13.plot: On a prior visit to California, Valerie Bertinelli's friends showed her how to grill breakfast, which started a fierce competition to see who could come up with the best all-day grill menu.

1.title: Be Prepared!
1.plot: Valerie helps a brand new Cub Scout earn his cooking badge; after-school snack of no-bake granola bars with a carob chocolate drizzle; chicken and broccoli over fettuccine in alfredo sauce; cinnamon strawberry twist; strawberry milkshakes.

2.title: Valerie Bertinelli: Ingredient Hunter!
2.plot: Valerie Bertinelli finds inspiration wherever she looks, including her local farm stand; she finds ingredients for a plum slab pie; summer vegetable gratin; spicy cucumber calamari salad with spiced yogurt sauce; boozy frozen espresso.

3.title: Touchdown!
3.plot: Valerie kicks off football season with a touchdown-worthy feast for family and friends; white chicken chili with a toppings bar; a football cheese ball with herbed crackers; a simple green salad with champagne vinaigrette; crunchy toffee buckeyes.

4.title: A Picture Worth Eating
4.plot: Tequila lime chicken wings with spicy avocado crema; chayote slaw with avocado and cilantro dressing; chile lime party mix; a mango tart with tequila lime glaze; mango tequila sunrise.

5.title: Soup 'n Wiches
5.plot: Marinated lamb chops with red wine and rosemary; Bloody Mary tea sandwiches; baked brie with almonds and apples; roasted asparagus pesto dip.

6.title: It's Payback Time
6.plot: Brown sugar sriracha bacon bites; asparagus in piggy blankets; tomato soup with grilled cheese croutons; caramel apple tarte tatin for dessert; toasting the 1980s with a fuzzy navel cocktail.

7.title: Tom's Hometown Favorites
7.plot: Valerie surprises her husband with some of his Ohio favorites; Ohio turkey chili; fried bologna bites; tomato and bibb lettuce salad; for dessert, vanilla and coffee cream cuffs.

8.title: My Delaware Days
8.plot: Valerie serves a menu of Delaware classics like steamed clams with spicy garlic bread, lump crab cakes with cocktail remoulade and sautéed spinach, chocolate peanut butter cakes and take-home gifts of homemade apple butter.

9.title: Gravy and Gratitude
9.plot: Thanksgiving dishes with new twists on traditional favorites; turkey roulade with cranberry citrus stuffing and pan gravy; root vegetable gratin; succotash salad; cream cheese log with sweet and spicy cranberry relish; a delectable pumpkin love cake.

10.title: Say Yes to the Veg
10.plot: Valerie tests new ways to sneak veggies into her recipes that kids will love. Her producer's two little grandsons visits. Recipes include baked mac and cheese with hidden cauliflower; jazzed-up sweet potato fries; spinach and red pepper stuffed chicken; and zucchini and ginger naked cake with ginger cream cheese frosting.

11.title: Celebrating 20 Years of Friendship
11.plot: Valerie Bertinelli invites three of her best friends over to celebrate two decades of friendship; hot spinach and crab dip; grilled eggplant parm; warm Brussels sprout salad; apricot Manhattans; cream cheese cherry galette.

12.title: Cookie Party Swap
12.plot: Valerie Bertinelli recreates the warm holiday feeling she grew up with, when her mother and aunts traded cookie recipes around the holidays, by hosting a festive cocktail party with cookies and small bites.

13.title: Tamale Party Time
13.plot: Valerie Bertinelli loves the holiday tradition of making tamales, so she invites over the best tamale makers she knows: Christy Vega Fowler, Lisa Ashley and Jo Oyakawa Stougaard.

1.title: On the Road Again
1.plot: Valerie Bertinelli is traveling to Chicago to give a keynote address at a women's expo, so she creates some healthy food to keep her energy up for this quick trip.

2.title: To Spain for a Little Bit of Everything: Tapas
2.plot: Following a trip to Spain, Valerie Bertinelli has developed a love of Spanish foods, especially the small plates, or tapas, that the Spaniards do so brilliantly.

3.title: Come Cassoulet with Me: A Decadent Dinner on a Dime
3.plot: Valerie Bertinelli loves a good slow-cooked dish and she's making a French classic, Cassoulet, for her friend, chef Ludo Lefebvre.

4.title: It's Getting Hot in Here
4.plot: Valerie Bertinelli prepares a game-day feast for local first responders; four-alarm chili; spicy cheesy pull-apart bread; smoky bacon jalapeno poppers; a flaming dark 'n' fiery cocktail; she cools things off for dessert with Grasshopper Ice Box Pie.

5.title: Surf's Up
5.plot: Valerie creates a Hawaiian-inspired feast for her husband, Tom, and his brother's family; her menu includes pineapple salsa with taro chips, a poke bar, roasted pork sliders, Valerie's spin on the mai tai, and chocolate macadamia candy for dessert.

6.title: Gal-entine's Day
6.plot: Valerie is showing her love and appreciation for her best girlfriends with a treat-filled lunch. The menu includes Green Pea Arancini with Herby Lemon Dipping Sauce followed by a Whole Roasted Side of Salmon and Escarole Salad with Roasted Meyer Lemon Vinaigrette. For dessert, a Citrus Pavlova.

7.title: Spicy Mud's New Orleans Favorites
7.plot: Valerie discovered some of her favorite foods while visiting her brother in Louisiana. So she's treating Patrick and his wife to some traditional New Orleans flavors. Muffaletta Bruschetta, Quick Rotisserie Chicken Gumbo, and King Cake.

8.title: Why Did the Chicken Cross the Road?
8.plot: Valerie challenges herself to use every part of the chicken in a delicious and creative menu, just as her mother and Nonnie used to do as part of their belief that nothing should go to waste.

imdb.title: Valerie's Home Cooking
plot: 'Valerie Bertinelli' (qv) prepares delicious home-cooked meals for her family and friends.::anonymous
